intro: Iberis grosmiquelii var. senneniana, commonly known as the Sennenian Iberis, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in dense, branched clusters. Its leaves are lobed and often covered in a fine layer of hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats.
